meanings.sent1: She would entreat her friend to come over for a visit.
meanings.sent2: I entreat you to consider my proposal carefully.
meanings.sent3: The child would entreat for more candy with puppy dog eyes.
meanings.sent4: The flowers entreat the sun to shine brightly upon them.
meanings.sent5: He would entreat the judge for mercy with tears in his eyes.

meanings.definition: To make an earnest request or petition
meanings.sent1: They entreat the council for better living conditions.
meanings.sent2: Please entreat the manager for an extension on the deadline.
meanings.sent3: The cat would entreat for more treats by meowing loudly.
meanings.sent4: The waves entreat the shore to embrace them with open arms.
meanings.sent5: She would entreat the gods for guidance in times of trouble.
